Calculation of plane of the sky Magnetic Fields

This function implements Hildebrand’s 2009 method to calculates the plane of the sky magnetic field using modified Davis-Chandrashekhar method.

StructureFunctionAnalysis.StructureFunctionAnalysis(path_to_datafile, bin_size, ColumnDensity, VelocityDispersion, SNR_limit=2)

This function implements Hildebrand’s 2009 method to calculates the plane of the sky magnetic field using modified Davis-Chandrashekhar method. The polarimetry data needs to be provied in a csv file with the following columns ‘ra’,’dec’,’PA’,’ePA’ The function also fits the line structure_function = np.sqrt(b**2 + l**2m**2)

Parameters

  • path_to_datafile (string) – relative path to the csv datafile with polarimetry data.

  • bin_size (float) – bin size to be used for calculating the structure function.

  • ColumnDensity (float) – column density of the target in number/cc units.

  • VelocityDispersion (float) – velocity dispersion value of the target in km/s

  • SNR_limit (flaot) – SNR ratio to be used to clean the data.

Returns

b parameter from the strucutre function in radians structure_function (2D list): The 2D array consists of the strucutre fucntion and its corresponding (l parameter)

Return type

b (float)
